itemDescription: British World War I flying ace

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant Edwin Arnold Clear  (28 May 1896 – 21 February 1960) was an English World War I flying ace credited with twelve aerial victories. Most unusually for a Royal Air Force ace of the era, all of his victories involved destruction of the enemy aircraft. Ill-health forced him to resign from the RAF in 1919, but he served in the RAF Reserve from 1923 to 1935.

response: * Edwin A. Clear, World War I ace
